name: Maximin Grünhaus
review: Trialling the sweeter dishes from our Japanese menu with a Riesling Kabinett. On its own, slightly effervescent, and sweeter than expected

name: Ionos
review: Gift from our kids, a very tasty wine, mineral and fresh but not without a hint of peaches, apricots and melons. Really nice Greek surprise!

name: Centurio
review: It was good, the only things is: I am not sure about the aroma and the after taste

name: Issac's Ram
review: A very interesting Cabernet Franc. Medium body, slightly prickly tannins, can be decanted beforehand, cherry acidity and slightly high alcohol, but the balance is practically not disturbed

name: Ménage à Trois
review: I usually only drink sweet wines. But this one isn't too dry. It is better by itself. I tried it with cheese and a chicken dish. But I prefer it alone.

name: Luca Paretti
review: A wonderful sparkling rosé! Light. The right amount of bubbles but not so dry that it slows you down throwing it back

name: Château La France
review: Quite light and medium bodied. Some nice floral notes and a tiny little bite at the end.
